FileReaderWriter

Method Detail

getFileContent

public static java.lang.String getFileContent(java.lang.String fileNameInclFullPath)
This method opens the file given by its name and full path (ie: C:/temp/testFile.xml), reads its content, closes the file again and returns the content as String. It is therfore assumed that the file content is ASCII text otherwise the behaviour of this method is not defined. If the file doesn't exist (ie. file name wrong or path not there) then null is returned.

Parameters:
fileNameInclFullPath - File name with fully qualified path.
Returns:
See description.

writeContentToFile

public static boolean writeContentToFile(java.lang.String content,
                                         java.lang.String fileNameInclFullPath)
This method writes the content to the file given by its name and fully qualified path (ie. C:/temp/testFile.xml). It is assumed that the path exists and that the file if it exists is closed otherwise false is returned. If the file doesn't exist then it will be created otherwise it will be overwritten (ie. not appended). If the file content is null then no action is taken.

Parameters:
content - Content to write into the file.
fileNameInclFullPath - Fully qualified path of the file to write to. If file doesn't exist it is created, oterwise it is overwritten.
Returns:
TRUE : All succeeded. FALSE: Something failed.

getFileBytes

public static byte[] getFileBytes(java.lang.String fileNameInclFullPath)
Returns a byte[]read from the given filename

Parameters:
fileNameInclFullPath - full path to file to read
Returns:
byte array containing file bytes. If there are any errors during processing then null is returned.

getFileBytes

public static byte[] getFileBytes(java.io.File file)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a byte[] read from the given file

Parameters:
file - file to read
Returns:
byte array containing file bytes. If there are any errors during processing then an exception is thrown.

java.lang.Exception

createFile

public static java.io.File createFile(java.lang.String fileNameInclFullPath,
                                      byte[] content)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a new file instance with the given path and filename and saves the given content to the file.

Parameters:
fileNameInclFullPath - Name of file to create. Can include path.
content - byte array containing the content to save in the file
Returns:
new file instance if successfully created and the given content was saved.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
